Now what do you want to test?

1. Th=
at main() parses the command line arguments correctly?

In this case, build=
 parsing into a separate class and test it. Perhaps the argument parser ans=
wers a Map of name -> argument value. In this case, it's easy to verify tha=
t the parser answers the expected Map.

Once you've done this, main() calls=

new MyClass(

t("blah"),

);

the casting, but not horrible.

2. That main() passes the parameters correc=
tly to MyClass' constructor?

Rather than expose getX() methods, add equals=
() that compares two MyClass objects and answers true if their fields have =
the same values. Then in your test, set up the "expected MyClass" with the =
argument values you expect main() to pass in and use assertEquals() to comp=
are them.
